bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, November 7, 1940

div1.p: Hutchison is checking on the items from the Lazear memorial event, which Hench requested. Hutchison requests that Hench send information on the plans for a yellow fever memorial so he can submit them to local newspapers.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, November 7, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
November 7, 1940

div1.p:
I am going to write you personally so I
will just answer the business portions of your
letter.

If you want to pay for the luncheon for
Wink and Johnny, it's all right. We won't fuss over
that. I have made out your check for two dollars
and sent it down to the Bursar's office.

I am checking with Mr. Brewer about the
pictures which you want, including one complete color
copy of all moving pictures taken on Founders' Day,
one copy each of all still pictures, and a number of
extra programs for the dinner. I do not know how many
of those you want but I take it from your letter
that you have written Mr. Brewer and told him how many.

Another matter of business- the Red and
Black and the local papers want to write up this matter
of your securing the cabin in which the experiments
were carried out and your plans for building a memorial.
Please write that up as you would like to see it in the
newspapers and let us have it. If they strike a
responsive cord somewhere you might get some support.

There does not look to me to be any possibility
of my being in New York on November seventh to thirteenth.
If a break comes whereby I might be there, I will let you
know immediately and get in touch with you.

Thank you for the grand letter. It was
wonderful to have you here and I cannot tell you how much
all of this meant to me. I will be writing you later but
I want to get this off so that it will reach you as soon
as you arrive in New York.
div1.closer:
Fraternally yours, Hutch Doctor Philip S. Hench
Hotel Roosevelt
New York City, New York
